dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 326 IH: Border Wall Waste Accountability Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Van Duyne (for herself, Ms. Tenney, Mr. Balderson, and Mr. Harris of Maryland) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Homeland Security

form.official-title: To require the GAO to conduct a study detailing the total cost of unused construction materials that were obtained for the construction of a border wall along the United States-Mexico border.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Border Wall Waste Accountability Act.

section.header: GAO study on cost of unused construction materials for border wall
section.text: Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this section, the Comptroller General of the United States shall submit to Congress a study detailing the total cost of unused construction materials that were obtained for the construction of a border wall along the United States-Mexico border from January 20, 2021, to January 20, 2025.
